result.execSummary:
The defendant David Estevan Olguin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--Fine and/or costs

--DNA Sample & Surcharge

--Other Costs & fees

--No physical discipline of any child

--The Defendant shall not engage in any acts or threats of violence

--The Defendant shall not have unsupervised contact with children under the age of 12, without the approval of the Department of Corrections, except as to contact with his biological child(ren).

--No direct/indirect contact with: C.R.S. (dob: 2/21/2012), unless approved by DOC and as approved by the batterer's treatment provider and any other treatment provider whether on informal basis or whether DOC has ordered him to work with treatment professional

--The Defendant shall undergo any assessment, treatment or therapies as directed by the Department of Corrections

--Successful completion of batterer's treatment

--Court presents basis, and denies expungement

--Court orders that Mr. Olguin report to JESO to have his DNA Sample taken today

--If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.


ARRESTING AGENCY: WATERTOWN PD

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #15CF219 and #17CF7 at 2:16pm.  
Defendant David E Olguin in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Plea Hearing is held in Case #17CF7 only:  
--Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Olguin guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
--On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

In Case #15CF219-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Olguin: 
--serve 12 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work, treatment and home-care, to commence forthwith
--days credit for time already served:  168 days
--the Court orders entry of a civil judgment for unpaid court-ordered financial obligations

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

In Case #17CF7-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Olguin to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is consecutive to any sentence in being including Case #15CF219.
The Court finds that Mr. Olguin is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Olguin is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  0 days credit for time already served.

The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Olguin on Probation for 30 months, with conditions: 
--to serve 7 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Work Release privileges, to commence on September 30th, 2017 at midnight 
--no direct or indirect contact with Bobbi Lou Schoeffling unless approved by the Agent
--to undergo AODA assessment, and follow through with recommended by the Agent 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as may be required
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment or education programming under the supervision of the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence 
--to participate in and complete Certified Battteres Intervention Treatment
--no possession or consumption of any alcohol
--no use of controlled substances without a physician's  prescription
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, and also to pay $115.73 for officer overtime costs related to the Preliminary Hearing

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 2:42pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 20, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] cases #17CF7 and #15CF219 called at 3:11pm. 
Defendant David Estevan Olguin in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.  ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
These cases were scheduled for Status Conference (#17CF7) and Sentencing After Revocation (#15CF219) today, however Attorney Fischer requests that the Court reschedule the hearing to allow the parties time to pursue a global resolution of both cases. 
recess 3:13pm

NEXT:   Status Conference (likely plea/sentencing) in case #17CF7, and Sentencing After Revocation in case #15CF219--both on June 20th at 2:00pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 5, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 10:04am. 
Defendant David Estevan Olguin in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case is scheduled for Sentencing After Revocation today.  
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance. 
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Beck.
Statements in support of the Defendant given by employer John Jeanson and by David Olguin Sr, father of the Defendant.
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Fischer.

The Court adjourns the Sentencing After Revocation hearing, indicating it needs more information from the Defense on the twenty sessions of Batterers Intervention that Mr. Olguin had and what remains to be completed with this programming.   
recess 10:30am.

NEXT:  schedule Sentencing in approximately 2-3 weeks (Attorney Fischer may contact the JA to arrange the date and time)
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 11, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Transcript of the Plea & Sentencing hearing on 4/8/16

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:18 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant David Estevan Olguin in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer submits letter along with plea paperwork
Victim rights compliance verified; ADA Beck informs the Court that the State did not receive any coorespondence from Miss Schoeffling, however did review letter submitted by Atty Fischer today which appears to be a victim statement

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions, as set forth on the criminal case settlement form, as adopted by the Court, which include: 
--The Defendant shall undergo any assessment, treatment or therapies as directed by the Department of Corrections
--No physical discipline of any child
--Fine and/or costs
--DNA Sample & Surcharge
--Other Costs & fees
--No direct/indirect contact with: C.R.S. (dob: 2/21/2012), unless approved by DOC and C.R.S. parents
--The Defendant shall not engage in any acts or threats of violence
--The Defendant shall not have unsupervised contact with children under the age of 12, without the approval of the Department of Corrections, except as to contact with his biological child(ren).

Court additionally orders:
--Successful completion of batterer's treatment
--Condition of probation regarding employment be striken from criminal case settlement and not be included on judgment

Court presents basis and modifies condition of probation regarding No Contact with C.R.S. as follows:
--No direct/indirect contact with: C.R.S. (dob: 2/21/2012), unless approved by DOC and as approved by the batterer's treatment provider and any other treatment provider whether on informal basis or whether DOC has ordered him to work with treatment professional

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Court presents basis, and denies expungement
Court orders that Mr. Olguin report to JESO to have his DNA Sample taken today
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 9:09 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 8, 2016 at 08:10 am.

Case called at 1:50 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for BrIII]
Defendant David Estevan Olguin in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer informs the Court that Mr. Olguin does not object to this court moving forward with today's waiver

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.

State files information

--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

ADA Hall: Agreed
off-record for scheduling: 1:56 - 1:58 pm
Court confirms address on file is accurate
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 1:58 pm

[MK] case called at 1:26pm. 
Defendant David Estevan Olguin appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert (PD appears for bond purposes only).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to counsel given
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence against any person 
--no contact with Brandon Hermance  
--no direct or indirect contact with Bobbi Lou Schoeffling, CRS, XRO
--no presence wherever CRS is present or at the residence of CRS, with the exception that Mr. Olguin may return to the residence one time before 9:00pm on 7/22/15, accompanied by a police officer, to retrieve personal possessions 
recess 1:33pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/9/15 at 9:20am  (2) Status Conference on 9/29/15 at 8:30am
